title: Graduate Software Engineer 2025
description:
As a leading financial services and healthcare technology company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut, and has 27,000+ employees in 35 countries.
Some 20,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest companies to small and mid-market firms, rely on SS&C for expertise, scale, and technology.
Role summary
Opportunity to contribute to key areas of a leading financial services organisation, across technology and operational functions. Graduates will develop essential workplace skills, gain exposure to real-world projects, and take part in structured learning to support long-term career development.
Key responsibilities
Software Development
Writing, testing, and debugging code in languages like .net.
Implementing features based on requirements and design specifications.
Following best coding practices and industry standards.
Learning & Development
Gaining proficiency in relevant technologies, frameworks, and tools.
Participating in code reviews and feedback sessions.
Understanding software development methodologies like Agile and Scrum.
Collaboration & Communication
Working closely with senior developers, product managers, designers and business analysts.
Attending team meetings and stand-ups to discuss progress.
Documenting code, processes, and technical findings.
Testing & Debugging
Writing unit and integration tests to ensure code reliability.
Debugging and troubleshooting software issues.
Assisting in quality assurance (QA) processes.
Version Control & Deployment
Using Git/TFS for version control.
Assisting in Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Learning about cloud services and deployment strategies.
Problem-Solving & Innovation
Researching and implementing new technologies.
Identifying and suggesting improvements to existing codebases.
Contributing to brainstorming and problem-solving sessions.
Learning & development
Completion of core learning modules, including financial services regulation, professional behaviours, and internal systems/processes.
Active participation in technical or operational training aligned with your role (e.g., coding, data analysis, process improvement, systems training).
Regular reviews with line managers and mentors to support continuous development.
Encouraged to work towards relevant professional qualifications (where applicable).
To carry out any other duties which are within the employee's skills and abilities whenever reasonably instructed
Technical requirements and qualifications
Recent graduate (or final-year student) with a degree in any discipline – STEM or business-related fields preferred for certain role.  To be expecting or have achieved a 2.2 degree classification or above. 
A strong interest in financial services and a desire to develop a career in technology, customer services or operations.
Analytical and problem-solving mindset, with attention to detail.
Proactive attitude with strong communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to learn new systems and concepts quickly.
Demonstrated adaptability and willingness to take on new challenges.
Core requirements
Regulatory
SS&C Employees are required to comply with the regulatory regime in which SS&C operates as appropriate to the above role.
Employees are expected to exercise due care and diligence, ensuring the areas the incumbent is responsible for are organised and controlled.
Employees are required to observe proper standards of market, business and personal conduct, demonstrating integrity in the execution of duties.
The incumbent is required to respect the SS&C approach to client care and must demonstrate due regard to the interests of our clients and in any and all third-party dealings.
To exercise due care and diligence, ensuring the areas the role is responsible for are organised and controlled.
To uphold responsibilities for risk and business continuity practices as appropriate to the position the role holds within the organisation.
To comply with the regulatory regimes in which SS&C operates, with consideration given to relevant Client Asset, Data Protection and Financial Crime Prevention regulations, as appropriate to the above role.
Quality
All employees are accountable for the delivery of a Quality service, driving for excellence in all their work activities:
To be quality driven, aiming for 100% accuracy and timeliness of delivery
To effectively plan the way services are delivered so that all activity is directly related to providing quality services and meeting the expectations of the customer (internal and external)
To continuously review processes and practices relating to the role and act as a catalyst for change and improvement in individual and team performance
To observe proper standards of market, business and personal conduct, demonstrating integrity in the execution of duties
To communicate and promote the values which reinforce and support a consistent quality culture
To ensure that monthly KPI’s are met and adhered to.
Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services.
SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.
essential_requirements: Recent graduate or final-year student (expecting or achieved 2:2 degree classification or above)
Strong interest in financial services and desire to build a career in technology, customer services or operations
Analytical and problem-solving mindset with attention to detail
Proactive attitude with strong communication and teamwork skills
Ability to learn new systems and concepts quickly; demonstrated adaptability
Willingness to participate in structured learning and regular reviews with managers/mentors
Commitment to regulatory compliance, due care and diligence, and professional conduct
Quality-driven focus with aim for accuracy and meeting KPIs
preferred_requirements: Degree in STEM or business-related discipline (preferred for some roles)
Experience or coursework in software development (particularly .NET/C#)
Familiarity with version control systems (Git or TFS)
Awareness or experience of Agile/Scrum methodologies
Exposure to testing practices (unit and integration testing) and QA processes
Basic knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and cloud deployment concepts
Interest in working toward relevant professional qualifications
Prior internship, placement, or project experience in financial services or technology
hard_skills: Familiarity with cloud services and deployment strategies
soft_skills: Attention to detail and quality focus
key_responsibilities: Develop software features: write, test and debug code (notably .NET), implement features from requirements/design and follow best coding practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: work with senior developers, product managers, designers and business analysts; attend stand-ups and document code/processes.
Support testing and delivery: write unit/integration tests, assist QA processes, use Git/TFS for version control and support CI/CD and cloud deployment activities.
tools_and_technologies: IDE/tools for .NET development (e.g., Visual Studio) — implied
Issue trackers and Agile tooling (e.g., Jira) — implied
company_values: Client care and acting in clients' best interests
Integrity and proper standards of market, business and personal conduct
tailoring_recommendations: Lead with education: state degree, classification (2:2 or above) and relevant modules (STEM/business coursework as applicable).
Feature relevant technical projects or internships using .NET/C#, including links to GitHub or code samples where possible.
List specific experience with Git or TFS, unit/integration testing, CI/CD or cloud concepts — even academic or lab experience counts.
Demonstrate Agile/Scrum exposure (team projects, roles, ceremonies attended) and participation in code reviews.
Include measurable outcomes: e.g., reduced defects, improved test coverage, delivery times, or KPI achievements.
Use ATS keywords from the job description in your summary, skills and project bullet points (e.g., .NET, Git, CI/CD, Agile, testing, financial services).
Showcase soft skills with short examples: teamwork (group projects), problem-solving (bug fixed or process improved), adaptability (new tech learned quickly).
Mention interest in financial services and awareness of regulatory/compliance responsibilities (data protection, client care).
If working towards professional qualifications, list them and expected completion dates; if not, state willingness to pursue.
Keep formatting ATS-friendly: simple headings, bullet points, no images or complex tables, and save as a PDF or DOCX as requested.
